column5: Australia
Yep! Been maintaining six months now.

I love listening to scientist tear apart the PACE trial. They‚Äôve hurt so many people and their science is still actively trying to hurt us as the remaining CFS Clinics in my city are all PACE based. It‚Äôs ridiculous. 

I just read they‚Äôre pushing this science into Covid patients and I‚Äôm in a rage.

Oh ffs, they have?!

Why aren‚Äôt those monsters in jail? Haven‚Äôt they done enough damage to the world?

If I go past 2,000 steps I become hyperactive. I start using energy that doesn‚Äôt exist. Then I can‚Äôt sleep until 5am that night. Then I‚Äôm up a few hours later starting to struggle. By 3pm I‚Äôm out cold. For the next week I sleep all day and am awake most of the night. I‚Äôm so tired that I can no longer sleep properly. My body aches like I‚Äôve been in a serious accident. I can‚Äôt regulate my temperature. If I stand too long I get light headed. The exhaustion is on my muscles and bones. That week if I push myself at all, I start to slur my words, then fully stutter, then my body starts slowing down finally walking as fast as I can is at a pace 10% that of my normal abilities. My limbs begin to shake. At that point I need to sedate myself. 

I‚Äôm bed bound daily as a prevention.

They do because they‚Äôre not taught otherwise. There‚Äôs so much evidence proving otherwise but so little funding and research.

Diet is a very popular self treatment method and helps a lot of patients. You also need to have enough energy to prepare nutritious meals. I can‚Äôt cook, don‚Äôt have the ability to stand that long. But mum makes me soups and I can heat them up. We all work with what we have. I‚Äôm lucky to have my parents caring for me.

I personally can go outside maybe once week and throw the ball for my dogs for about ten minutes. They have to bring it back for me. I can‚Äôt go for walks, I need to keep my steps under 2,000 a day or I‚Äôll suffer severe PEM.

The doctors that believe it‚Äôs a mental illness are the worst. Some blamed my weight, I had really bad coping mechanisms (everyone in lockdown can understand now) and got to 300lbs. I was desperate for help so I found an amazing doctor and with his help lost 150lbs in 15mths. My illness is not in my head nor did I do it to myself gaining weight. I‚Äôm as healthy as I can possibly be and fighting as hard as I can. I‚Äôm still stuck in bed 22hrs a day.

We‚Äôre not sure if it‚Äôs genetic. No one else in my family is as sick as I am, but I know of families where every generation has a form of ME/CFS.

Mine could be because of the severity of my viral illness, 1 out of 200 people survive the level of sepsis I had. So in a sense I‚Äôm extremely lucky but out of those 1/200 how many fully recover? I have no idea.

Thank you üíô

It is terrifying and why you‚Äôll find some of us in the wild like here, self advocating. We have a very large online community now and are expecting Covid patients are going to need us to help guide them, which we will do to the best of our ability.

I did, thank you. I‚Äôm in the fb groups, they‚Äôre so helpful with hacks. I actually needed to take a different medication with 8mg of naltrexone for a few months, did nothing for me ME/CFS but made trying LDN at different dosages obsolete. 

I‚Äôm currently trying the Ubiquinol plus antioxidant regimen recommended by a US Immunologist (I‚Äôll link it, there‚Äôs also a transcript in the comments) and will be doing this a few months more before talking to my doctor about LDN again. Self compounding seems so intimidating! I need to get my head around it x


https://youtu.be/pkGXiJ1jM14
Thank you üíô
Gotten worse.

Thank you! I developed bad coping mechanisms and then I smashed them.

I have much more pain post weight loss which is the opposite of what my doctors and I expected and it‚Äôs complete bullshit üòÇ

It‚Äôs not my intention to scare but just to inform patients that sometimes there is a third outcome between death and fully recovered. Doctors don‚Äôt like to talk about it. 

Some members of the community are going to end up chronically ill, this will impact them for the rest of their lives. Many will be absolutely fine!! 

This community has something ME/CFS sufferers don‚Äôt have though, a voice that people are listening to. So when inevitably it is six months from now and some are still unwell, they will need allies to advocate for science and medicine to keep working, keep fighting and finally make that link as to why some of us who suffer a viral infection never recover. Your community may be the key to curing us all. 

So as thrilled as I am that you are feeling better. Don‚Äôt forget about those of us who aren‚Äôt. And the Covid sufferers who may not. We will need your voice too.

Graded exercise has been found to be harmful for ME sufferers. There was a study called the PACE trial that claimed it was a cure, but years later the results reviewed and found their data fraudulent. Many countries still have clinics that still use it to base their ME/CFS treatments, federal guidelines which have not been updated and doctors in the community who are taught the wrong treatment methods. It‚Äôs hurt so many ME patients. We have a lot of obstacles as sufferers, unfortunately.

Graded exercise is helpful for so many other illnesses though and I‚Äôm very glad you found relief.
I‚Äôm a ME patient giving Covid patients unsolicited medical advice in my original comment. There‚Äôs no need to be aggressive.

No. Infectious Disease sent my tests country wide to try and find an answer and it was never discovered. ‚ÄúUnknown viral infection‚Äù is the best we ever came up with.

I‚Äôve since seen an Immunologist, Haematologist, Rheumatologist, Endocrinologist and CFS Specialists and no one can find anything.
I‚Äôve never had mono so can‚Äôt personally comment, though many sufferers do say their ME/CFS was triggered by Glandular Fever.

So post ICU your body feels like it‚Äôs just survived death and it has. It‚Äôs exhausted. Then that part never quite goes away. Then you find physical activity exacerbates all your symptoms and you‚Äôre stuck in this weird limbo of only being able to do 1,500 steps a day. If you go over, everything is so much worse for weeks.

Mentally so many things change too. I can‚Äôt concentrate to read books. I‚Äôm not as articulate. I lose my train of thought. I‚Äôm forgetful. 

Over the years symptoms change. Now if I push myself too far my body starts to shut down. It begins with slurred speech and a stutter then my arms and legs will stop working. So when I start to not be able to speak, I treat it as a ‚Äúpanic attack‚Äù and sedate myself with Valium. I wake up fine.

I haven‚Äôt heard if it. It‚Äôs really unfortunate that we have such small trials and so little funding because science is finding things and making progress, it‚Äôs just such a slow process. 

We need an ice bucket challenge level of awareness but we can‚Äôt do it because we‚Äôre all stuck in bed. 

Also, a lot of sufferers the past year since the star of Unrest (a Netflix documentary about ME/CFS) found her own ‚Äúcure‚Äù have discovered it‚Äôs an issue with their spinal cord. They‚Äôre having fusion surgery and the CFS symptoms disappear.

Most days I feel like a healthy person would if they had the flu and had also fallen down a flight of stairs. My body is exhausted in ways words can‚Äôt describe. 

But if I push myself and get PEM, I start to slur my words. Then fully stutter. Then I can no longer speak and when I try to walk it‚Äôs at 10% my normal pace. My limbs stop working. 

If I don‚Äôt rest 22hrs a day and meticulously plan my physical activity, my body shuts down. 

https://www.emerge.org.au/what-is-mecfs
I have parrots! They‚Äôre my happiness every day and don‚Äôt mind that I‚Äôm in bed x

Our local CFS Clinic used a combination of eastern and western medicine. Unfortunately it closed last year after the last real CFS doctor in my city passed away. 
Lots of gut health and supplements. 

Many of us take LDN which is experimental but helps with inflammation, it takes a long time to find the right microdose, I had a reaction last time so will try again at a later date. 

Currently I‚Äôm taking a high antioxidant cocktail that after a few months may increase energy. I‚Äôm very poor but hopeful. Always have to stay optimistic!

I was 26, fully independent, living alone, working full time, very healthy and now I‚Äôm 34 and have been housebound for over 7 years. 

I do get out once a month for appointments and I look the picture of health, you cannot tell I‚Äôm sick, except I slept in preparation the entire week before. I can‚Äôt walk far. I can‚Äôt stand long. I will overheat very easily. But I hold on to my once a month outings, take a bunch of pain meds, drink my body weight in coffee and endure the week of suffering after. 

ME/CFS doesn‚Äôt have a ‚Äúknown cause‚Äù generally most of us suffered a viral infection at some point. 

There‚Äôs a documentary on Netflix called Unrest about us.

The defining characteristic for ME/CFS is Post-exertional malaise (PEM) ‚ÄúPost-exertional malaise (PEM) is the worsening of symptoms following even minor physical or mental exertion, with symptoms typically worsening 12 to 48 hours after activity and lasting for days or even weeks.‚Äù

If physical activity was helpful for your body, it‚Äôs unlikely that you have ME/CFS. Which is a great thing, hopefully one day you‚Äôre diagnosed with something that has a treatment.

All the best.

I truly hope your doctor is correct but unfortunately know that some survivors will end up chronically ill.

I‚Äôm not a Covid survivor. I‚Äôm a viral infection survivor from 2013, who went through multiple organ failure (full renal), septic shock & pneumonia. I was assured a three month full recovery period. I‚Äôm still stuck in bed 22hrs a day and no doctor can find any reason in testing. I have ME/CFS. A diagnosis of exclusion with no treatment. 

The first six months post infection are so important. Be safe, be kind to your bodies and I wish you great health x
Yeah but the inattentive level of these employees is GOT S8 level bad... oh wait.

Tbh sounds even more complicated than BPD (if that‚Äôs possible). 

You have to be able to talk for this to continue. She needs to be able to have a safe word that indicates she needs space when overwhelmed and hopefully begins to trust you more. 

You deserve some stability too x

Nope! Out of sight = abandoned. You push them away, you regret it, you push them away harder you regret it even more but get so worked up about how terrible and useless you are, BPD logic tells you to kill yourself.

If she‚Äôs in treatment and can feel herself becoming obsessed and codependent, maybe that‚Äôs why she‚Äôs asking for space? Therapist recommended for her own sanity. That‚Äôs rare. 

I can‚Äôt really speculate further, the only way you‚Äôll ever know is if she can communicate it with you, which may not be possible.

So she has a deep fear of abandonment and will misinterpret a lot of things you do. ‚ÄúIf I leave him he can‚Äôt leave me‚Äù mentality but she desperately doesn‚Äôt want to be alone. It‚Äôs why she‚Äôs hot and cold. She‚Äôs literally in constant fight of flight mode and I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôve seen the worst of it yet. 

I‚Äôm BPD in remission, we do exist. Medication, therapy and accepting that we need to constantly work on ourselves. It can be done.

I don‚Äôt know what you should do. She‚Äôs going to continue to be high maintenance. She needs to comply to treatment to stop the cycle and no one can force her. It‚Äôs a decision she needs to make for herself.
Thank you ‚ô•Ô∏è

I‚Äôm excited to eventually see it. Have enjoyed my first week on the app. 

I already track my food through a different app so don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd have the headspace for this, but if it could eventually import food data from Apple (if even possible), that‚Äôd be awesome. 

Unrelated, an idea to track self care. Showering for instance I can only do twice a week and it triggers my illnesses, I‚Äôd love to track that. 

Thank you for all this.
Touch√©!!
I‚Äôm currently addicted to buying dresses. It‚Äôs winter and I can‚Äôt leave the house. You the same?
Girls read the bios.

I was twitter friends way back with the dude that wrote the original and many of these fucking bios.
You don‚Äôt deserve matches if you can‚Äôt write a bio.

I‚Äôm BPD in remission, this doesn‚Äôt sound BPD.
Regardless, an armchair diagnosis isn‚Äôt going to change the fact that he‚Äôs an abusive asshole that you‚Äôre lucky to have escaped.

Enjoy your freedom ‚ô•Ô∏è

That was a lot to read.

Stay sober. Get DBT books and continue your therapy alone if you can‚Äôt attend sessions. Life will continue to progress if you prioritise your health.

You grew up in a strict household/lifestyle where you couldn‚Äôt be your true gender. Case closed. There‚Äôs your trauma. You don‚Äôt have to be molested or beaten to develop BPD. 

Focus on the now and continuing to be well.

Awesome! ‚ô•Ô∏è

I‚Äôve realised it‚Äôs my reset button. My sleep goes back to normal, if I‚Äôm trying to lose weight it comes off that week (I did a big 15mth -150lbs transformation recently), my moods improve, HR is healthier. 

I may need to talk to my endocrinologist about it!

Mine drops! 

10 BPM lower than this time last week, period started yesterday. 

(I‚Äôm chronically ill, so probably the weird one here.)
Disgusting Americans.
You did great ‚ô•Ô∏è

When the ME/CFS community initially saw the pandemic effects we expected the unfortunate climb in covid patients that will inevitably join us in the too hard basket.

It is entirely too soon and you are too unwell to focus on this right now. Eat, drink, sleep and survive. In this monumental task, I‚Äôm sending you strength. 

When you can, find the advocacy groups that already exist. MEAction is big in the UK & America (Emerge in Australia). They already have contacts in government and will know where to send you and your personal advocates to make some noise.

You have all my sympathy and I hope your new issues overnight resolve. You need to see someone about the new symptoms!

I am not a survivor of Covid.

I‚Äôm a survivor of an unknown viral infection that caused multiple organ failure (full renal failure) and septic shock when I too was 26 and in full health.

That was over 7 years ago. 

I‚Äôm still bedbound 22hrs a day and have a diagnosis of ME/CFS. There‚Äôs no treatment and nothing I can do to improve my health.

I‚Äôm in Australia. I have seen every specialist imaginable. Every doctor is excited to meet me and try and figure out the cause of my illness and each one runs their tests and within a year each admits defeat. Can‚Äôt find a thing. 

I hope that you guys are able to find advocates and energised family members to continue this fight. They need to be loud and relentless. Find as much help as you can, you will have limited energy and you need to rest as much as possible. 

The only thing on your side now is that they won‚Äôt be able to deny the ongoing issues when it‚Äôs such a large percentage of the population that will be suffering. 

Keep fighting xxx

Not cold urticaria but chronic the past 8yrs. 

2x 180 fexofenadine twice daily (as per immunologist).
All other meds and remedies just exasperated it. 

Once my symptoms settled I was able to reduce to once daily. If I forget one dose, flairs up immediately.
Thanks!

The comment above yours said it was and the thread has a lot of defensive replies. 

I appreciate your kind response.

I always had the best time at my Sri Lankan‚Äôs friends house parties, I would be the only white woman there and I love learning about the cultural differences and being treated to great food. I know from my good friend and experience at many workplaces that it‚Äôs not normal behaviour.

It‚Äôs these insufferable douchbags that make a bad name for everyone. 

But woman still need to be able to vent our frustrations without a #notallmen response.

My cousin was dating an Indian man at one point and we went out dancing, later in the night when my cousin was distracted he grabbed me and aggressively whispered in my ear ‚ÄúI wish I had met you first‚Äù. I had to fight to get free. 

I once had a South Asian taxi driver take me home late at night. We chatted the entire way, just polite conversation. After paying he asked me if I‚Äôd ‚Äúlike to take a drive‚Äù and it took ten minutes to convince him to let me leave the car.

Is this racist just because I mention the race of the predator?
Just take a multivitamin, you‚Äôll be fiiiiine

I remember back in the days I went clubbing (10yrs ago in Melbourne, Australia) there‚Äôd very often be a single South Asian man alone waiting in the outskirts of the dance floor. You‚Äôd accidentally make eye contact and instantly they‚Äôd be grinding against you begging you to take them home. They would refuse to take no for an answer and it‚Äôd take a friend intervening or a helpful stranger. You‚Äôd then see the same man all night trying the technique on all the girls who were various degrees of drunk. 

You‚Äôd end up watching out for every girl on the dance floor and inevitably they‚Äôd find one drunk enough by the end of the night, which is why when lights went on you‚Äôd grab onto that girl for dear life and reunite her with her friends, while this pervert insists she‚Äôs agreed to leave with him, she wants to, he‚Äôll ‚Äúlook after‚Äù her. 

It happened so many times. 

I imagine these same entitled men are OL dating and just as predatory.
My struggles in comparison ‚Äúmake a great story‚Äù ü§¨
I‚Äôll keep my money saved and wait. Thanks so much!!

Meh.
I, with no underlying health conditions, became septic and suffered multiple organ failure at 26. 

I‚Äôve been mostly housebound since then and am now 34. I try online dating every few years but it‚Äôs a shitshow. I don‚Äôt have much to offer without the option to work, have a family, look after a household. 

Life is literally passing me by.

I‚Äôm bitter sometimes but I was suppose to die, so I‚Äôll take what I can get. Still more upset that they butchered the ending of GOT.
Thank you!

Agreed, that‚Äôs what‚Äôs I‚Äôd be doing.

We‚Äôre not evil, we‚Äôre terrified of rejection and being abandoned, so make very bad choices when under pressure x
Which is?

I haven‚Äôt updated since the 7+ so I excuse my ignorance. When are we expecting the 12? 

I‚Äôm so excited to finally upgrade.
Fags

I did it. Lost 150lbs in 15mths that way and have maintained it 5months so far. I also never lost any hair. 

People who are successful long term on the shakes are very rare. I know of three, each in a different country.

It‚Äôs impossible to predict. 

With change comes uncertainty.

With your focus having to move their fear of abandonment may force them to feel like pushing you away is their only opinion for survival. 

Their need for reassurance is not going to subside even when you‚Äôre busy and overwhelmed.

You don‚Äôt know how well they‚Äôre going to respond to therapy or it the new environment will trigger meltdowns. 

I imagine it‚Äôll be rough. I‚Äôm BPD and that level of change even though I‚Äôm ‚Äúin remission‚Äù makes me cringe. 

You‚Äôre going to need a lot of patience and understanding.
Clementine üñ§

A friend made a joke that I could use some KFC because I was in size S pants (-150lbs) ...I pulled out my loose skin tummy and did a silly dance. 

I thought it was hilarious at least!
Dealing with creepy men and nice guys professionally, you have my respect.

We‚Äôre at moderate risk as per an immunologist who specialises in ME/CFS. She also lists some supplements we can take to boost our immune system, I‚Äôve been on them three weeks now as a precaution. 

https://youtu.be/pkGXiJ1jM14

It‚Äôs really common for us to continue to have body image issues during weight loss and even at goal weight. I‚Äôm -150lbs and still see myself as fat. I‚Äôm not. I‚Äôm in a size small. Body dysmorphia is insane.

Take your measurements and photos because you may not SEE the progress you expect in real time.
I left it on the white hospital sheets, like a LADY!
You‚Äôre very welcome x

I‚Äôm very sorry you lost your mum. So few of us survive. Sending love to you!

Keep fighting! You will get there, I believe in you xxx

It‚Äôs a complicated riddle whatever it is! 

There is a new subset of patients it seems that are suffering spinal instability and fusion surgery is curing them. The creator of the documentary Unrest is one of them. It‚Äôs exciting to see where that leads. 

I have parrots and cats and dogs so I‚Äôm lucky to have a full house üíï
noooooo

I can remember my best booger.

This is very gross TMI. 

I was septic in ICU and had been out of it for days wearing the oxygen nose thingy to discover the slight discomfort was booger build up (One of the many discomforts of ICU!). Huge thick crusty and bloody. I was still really sick but you better believe I had the best pick and got the most disgusting boogers of my life out. Breathing was much easier after.
‚ÄúBanter‚Äù
Thank you!
She‚Äôs not invited back!! üòÅ

Thank you!

Looks are deceiving. I‚Äôm so weak now!! All my strength was in my size. We got a new puppy last year and I have to be really careful because he‚Äôs almost knocked me on my ass SO many times. My old boy helps me up and down the stairs like a gentleman... but this little asshole üòÇ

I‚Äôm the opposite. I‚Äôm enjoying maintenance. I heard all the horror stories!

My doctor gave me a threshold of 4.4lbs that my weight is allowed to fluctuate but if I hit that number during weekly weigh ins, I have to get back into the diet. 800 calories and those shakes. The thought of going back on them again makes me feel ill. After 15 months of shakes I NEVER want to do that again. It‚Äôs a powerful motivator!! 

His maintenance calories for me was 1600. I adjusted down 100 as I was slowly gaining, as you do because our bodies are holding onto more fluid now during maintenance. 

I just track everything. If a certain food doesn‚Äôt fill me up, then I don‚Äôt deem it worthy ongoing. I had hot cross buns recently and they were an old fav but now they‚Äôre just not dense enough to justify the calories, I prefer a fruit English muffin. Or for breakfast I try and have high protein yoghurt with all bran cereal (like a nana) so I hit my fibre for the day early. 

It‚Äôs all about pre planning, experimenting and cutting out the things that don‚Äôt really bring you joy. I LOVE fruit juice, it‚Äôs my vice. I do not love it enough to waste 200 calories every single day.

I found ways to enjoy everything I love and missed. It just takes a bit of work. 

You also need to weigh every single portion. It‚Äôs a pain but I think it‚Äôs the secret.

Thank you!!

Ask for professional help. A dietician will reach you to eat healthy. A weight loss doctor (mine was an endocrinologist) will teach you how to lose weight. If it gets hard make another appointment and ask for more help. There are a few medications on the market that can reduce appetite. It‚Äôs not a miracle cure but it gives us a fighting chance. 


Now in the days of isolation going out for appointments is difficult so what I learnt is CICO (calories in vs calories out) is the ONLY scientific way to lose weight. You google your TDEE put in your stats and you‚Äôve got a guide on what calories you can consume to lose weight. 

Then find the weight loss fad diets or ‚Äúthe tools‚Äù that appeal to you. Keto for instance suppresses hunger. IF - intermittent fasting gives you a specific window a day to eat in and is very helpful for structure.

I used all three together. Counted my calories, kept my carbs low (to suppress appetite) and didn‚Äôt start eating until late because my craving hit at night. 

Those are all my magic tips. It‚Äôs not easy but it can be done!!!

Congratulations on a strong start!!! 

150 wasn‚Äôt a goal I set, it was my doctors. It‚Äôs healthy BMI. It terrified me!! I never imagined getting there, let alone maintaining it. But prior to antidepressants, this was my natural size, right up until my early 20‚Äôs. I wasn‚Äôt a large kid or teen. 

It‚Äôs a nice size. I feel healthy (I‚Äôm not so it‚Äôs a start!!). Maintenance calories for me being inactive is 1500, so I‚Äôm not all that restricted. The smaller you get the less you get to eat daily and I missed food so much that I now hit my calories every day with the best foods üòÅ

I wish you all the very best! x
Thank you so much!!

Aw, thank you very much!

It‚Äôs so easy to feel hopeless when you‚Äôre unwell. It‚Äôs a lot like the hopelessness we‚Äôre all feeling through this pandemic. I‚Äôve been there and if I can help by jumping on here every so often, then its my pleasure. 

Massive weight loss is never easy üíô
Thank you!
Thank you x
Thanks babe!!

Aw thanks for reaching out!! 

Getting it these days isn‚Äôt much better, the medical community is still behind but at least with the internet and advocacy groups like Emerge we‚Äôre finally in it together. We‚Äôre still fighting the recommended treatment from the fraudulent PACE trial.

I‚Äôm so glad you were able to recover!!! That‚Äôs incredible
and to have a family! It was once my dream üíú

I‚Äôve actually been on so many antibiotics, a few triple doses when I contracted H.Pylori and 8yrs of chronic sinusitis until surgery last year finally cleared that up so I can say I‚Äôve tried that myself and it hadn‚Äôt helped, unfortunately. 

Also the antibiotics they used initially while I was in septic shock killed everything dead. Good and bad bacteria. They didn‚Äôt know what they were fighting so tried everything. 

I really appreciate you sharing your story, did make me rethink that I had been blasted by antibiotics!!

So very glad you‚Äôre well x
Thank you

Getting started is so bloody hard.

I wish you all the very best xxx

I‚Äôm able to have chocolate this year! Last year there was none allowed, so it‚Äôs extra fun today! 

Have a great day x
üòÅ Thank You!!!

I am! I have so many fun outfits waiting to wear!

I like to do makeup and use to have to contort to strange angles for photos to hide my weight. Now, it‚Äôs just my face! That‚Äôs one of my favourite parts.

My illness may have made it easier in that I‚Äôm generally isolated so less temptations. I only went out for dinner a handful of times during the diet and took a meal replacement bar and ordered black coffee, made others uncomfortable but became so easy to say no. I enjoyed watching what others were eating and wasn‚Äôt tempted.

Thanks love! It does.

You keep fighting xxx

Thank you!

I appreciate the suggestion. 

My illness was triggered by septic shock, it‚Äôs not something that diet can generally touch. 

I do have friends within the ME/CFS community that have tried the various diets, including carnivore, from memory it makes us very sick. Because our cells create so little energy of their own, we generally need carbs. I know that sounds ridiculous after I was low carb for 15 months but I was surviving off fat stores. 

I personally struggle to eat a lot of meat, so it really wouldn‚Äôt work for me. The protein part of my Optifast diet was actually the hardest part üòÇ

Ahaha!!!

My DMs are always a shit show after posting these. It‚Äôs exhausting.

My weight loss doctor is an endocrinologist.
We used Optifast plus protein but also used medications to help with cravings. I took .6mg Saxenda, 25mg Topamax & Contrave. To get me through the 15 months on 800 calories. He didn‚Äôt recommended introducing exercise until I was at goal weight and moving to a maintenance diet, I was unable to and that‚Äôs okay. I do what I can. 

I also had severe issues with period. At highest weight we could no longer control it. It wouldn‚Äôt stop without medication. I had issues with cysts for years and very heavy flow. 7 days of maternity pad flow. I now have 3-4 day light periods. 

Have a chat with your doctors, chose a low calorie plan and fight!

All the very best xxx

Or as some perv in my DM‚Äôs has said ‚Äúlook at that gap! beautiful‚Äù üòÇ

Thank you!!!
